title: Chief Operating Officer (COO) Job at Flees Global Services
content:
Flees Global Services (FGS) Limited is a leading Oil and Gas Company in Port Harcourt and we are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design and execute a 5-year EPCIM growth strategy aligned with Nigeria’s energy transition goals
	Drive market positioning to secure high-value EPCIM contracts (e.g., NNPC, TotalEnergies, Shell).
	Oversee the integration of engineering, procurement, construction, installation, and maintenance functions to ensure cohesive project delivery and local content mandates (NCDMB Act).
	Lead the positioning of the company in securing new EPCIM contracts through strategic business development and excellent project execution.
	Identify opportunities for growth, operational improvements, and innovation within the EPCIM framework to maintain competitive advantage.
	Identify targeted prospective client’s projects/budgets for the next one year and pursue at least two new business opportunities that must yield desired results per month
	Oversee the development of engineering solutions and innovations that enhance project efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and safety.
	Ensure the company remains at the forefront of engineering job delivery by promoting the adoption of best practices and new technologies Oversee engineering design compliance with API, ASME, ISO 9001, and SON standards.
	Lead R&D initiatives to reduce project costs by 15% through value engineering.
	Provide leadership in engineering design and execution processes, ensuring that all technical specifications and dispositions meet industry standards, project requirements, and regulatory compliance.
	Develop a workplan and implement a growth strategy to expand our corporate fortunes/revenue drive Develop a prospect pipeline targeting 2+ new business opportunities monthly.
	Provide leadership in engineering design and execution processes, ensuring that all technical specifications and dispositions meet industry standards, project requirements, and regulatory compliance.
	Oversee the development of engineering solutions and innovations that enhance project efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and safety.
	Ensure the company remains at the forefront of engineering job delivery by promoting the adoption of best practices and new technologies Oversee engineering design compliance with API, ASME, ISO 9001, and SON standards.
	Lead R&D initiatives to reduce project costs by 15% through value engineering.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, (An MBA or Master’s Degree Engineering Management is a plus.)
	Minimum of 20 - 25 years of experience as Chief Operating Officer or General Manager in the oil and gas or energy sector.
	Must be NSE or COREN certified


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and commercial awareness
	Strong industry network and client engagement skills
	Technical understanding of energy products and services
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively
	Goal-oriented and highly motivated
	Strong Leadership and interpersonal relationship (networking skill)
	Strong negotiation skill
	Strong budget/financial management and reporting skill
	Strong business development skill
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV in PDF to: robertituboala@gmail.com or info@fleesglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Logistics Officer Job at Goonite (NG) Hygiene Product FZE
content:
Goonite (NG) Hygiene Product FZE, a major manufacturer and distributor company in the FMCG Distribution Sector for premium brands in the Health and Personal Care category like Lebrace Diaper and Besense Sanitary Pads meeting household needs in a vastly diversified demography.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer
Job Location: Ibeju-Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Will be responsible for onboarding credible transporters with high emphasis on cost reduction/control.
	Understand the types and qualities of trucks required for shipment.
	Will be responsible for following up with transporters regarding truck bookings and transit issues.
	Must be abreast of the rate for various locations.
	Collaborating with Sales Managers to optimize shipping routes for efficient results.
	Must ensure that the respective expected time of arrivals are met.
	Must ensure trucks arrivals are timely and trucks offload without shortages
	Must have a good understanding of the parameters that affect rate fluctuation.
	Provide excellent customer service to internal and external stakeholders, addressing any concerns or questions related to shipments.


Requirements


	HND or BSc in any related field.
	Must have 1 - 2 Years of working experience in same role.
	Must have worked in the FMCG Industry Preferably Diaper & Sanitary Pad companies.
	Excellent communication and analytical skills.
	Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
	Must reside within Ibeju-Lekki and it immediate environs.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: estherajideofficial@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates who lives in the above location will be contacted.

title: Job Openings at Prince OJ Global Services Limited
content:
Prince OJ Global Services Limited is a fast consumer goods company incorporated in Nigeria with head office in Onitsha Anambra state, We deal on importation and distribution of top quality wines and spirits, spices, tomato, spaghetti, oil, margarine, baking powder, liquid milk and many more...

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Marketer (Male / Female)

Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Overseeing all marketing-related activities within a territory
	Executing marketing strategies to align with business goals, including brand building, market penetration, and revenue generation.
	Develop and implement marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, content, and traditional marketing.
	Work jointly with the internal and external stakeholders, including sales teams, other departments, and external agencies.
	Tracking and analyzing the effectiveness of marketing efforts and make data-driven decisions.
	Analyzing market trends, competitive landscapes, and customer needs to identify opportunities and develop strategies.
	Responsible for analyzing sales numbers in comparison to the marketing budget in order to find the profit margin and which campaigns were most effective
	Research competitors to stay current with similar products or services on the market
	Work with the sales team to develop successful strategies and campaigns that attract new customers and keep current clients.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree or HND in a releted field
	Must have completed NYSC
	Must be computer literate
	Ability to market new products and achieve a success rate in a mapped territory
	Proven experience in the position above, preferably in FMCG Company
	Strong leadership skills and the ability to effectively manage a team
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Goal-oriented mindset and a driven personality
	Self-motivated and results-driven with a strong work ethic
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary


	N70,000 Monthly


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@ojglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Experienced Auditor

Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Carry out audit exercise as may be directed by head audit.
	Conduct physical stock count and also monitor stock report on a daily basis on the whatsapp plat form.
	Review of closing and opening balance of stock to ascertain if they correspond.
	Review of daily sales to find out if the price of each product correspond with the price sold to the customer
	Check cash sales to ensure that they are lodged into the bank or submitted to cashier in the case of head office branches.
	Confirm transfer from the customer into the various bank account to ensure they are correct and accurate as in the bank statement.
	Review of expenses to ensure that they are duly approved and that disbursements are in line with the company policy.
	Prepare and present audit reports on their findings to the management
	Monitor on a daily basis stock report and cash payment.
	Verify and reconcile all bank statement and sign off


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in a related field.
	Proven experience in the position above.
	Must have completed NYSC.
	Must have accounting background.
	Self-motivated and results-driven with a strong work ethic.
	Strong leadership skills and the ability to effectively manage a team.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Goal-oriented mindset and a driven personality.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@ojglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Inventory Officer (Male or Female)

Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Record and keep accurate information on stock
	Overseeing daily/weekly/monthly updating of stock movement
	Ensure that warehouse staff are up to date with their records (book)
	Prompt distribution of products to branches and outlets as requested.
	Ensure there is no damage of products arising from personal handling.
	Provide stock reports as and at when needed
	Ensure periodic stock-taking and submission of stock reconciliation report
	Safeguard the warehouses
	Monitoring of sales of products through branch stock report before releasing products
	Monitor stock level to avoid over stocking or shortages
	Ensure products are picked up for delivery to branches as at when due.
	Training - Provide training and understanding to various departments regarding stock control.
	Other ad hoc projects relating to stock and system management.


Requirements


	Minimum of a Degree in a related field
	At least 1 year of experience
	Must be computer literate
	Excellent communication skills, both oral and verbal
	Great interpersonal skills
	Customer service and relationship-building skills
	Teamworking skills
	Strong attention to details
	Analytical Skills.


Salary
N70,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@ojglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Creative Assistant (Content Creator / Social Media Manager) Job at Classic Organics
content:
Classic Organics is a premium skincare and hair care brand dedicated to crafting exceptional products for children, adults, and men. We combine elegance with efficacy, offering premium solutions that nurture, protect, and enhance. Our range embodies the perfect harmony of science and nature, elevating everyday care into an indulgent experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Assistant (Content Creator / Social Media Manager)
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled and creative Content Creator to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and managing engaging content, staying ahead of industry trends, and driving our brand’s presence on social media platforms.
	This role demands a mix of creativity, strategic thinking, and expertise in social media management.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute creative content strategies that align with the brand’s goals.
	Create and schedule high-quality posts across all social media platforms.
	Monitor and respond to comments across platforms to foster engagement and community growth (excluding DMs).
	Analyze social media performance and provide actionable insights to improve engagement.
	Collaborate with the team to brainstorm and execute innovative content ideas, including photo and video shoots.
	Stay updated on industry trends and incorporate them into content creation.
	Work closely with other departments to ensure cohesive branding and messaging.
	Ensure all content is aligned with the company’s vision and standards of excellence.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Content Creator or Social Media Manager.
	Strong knowledge of major social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, TikTok).
	Ability to create visually appealing and compelling content.
	Excellent communication and writing skills.
	A deep understanding of content trends and digital marketing strategies.
	Experience with social media analytics tools.
	Creative thinking and the ability to generate original ideas.
	Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Portfolio to: therecruit.classic@gmail.com using "Application for Content Creator & Social Media Manager Position" as the subject of the mail.

title: General Manager Job at Fadac Resources and Services Limited
content:
Fadac Resources and Services Limited - Our client, a leading firm dedicated to delivering innovative, high-quality solutions in the construction and engineering sectors, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented, thorough, and organized leader to oversee OMR’s daily operations and manage the business aspects of the company.
	In this position, you will play a key role reviewing and implementing operational procedures, assisting departmental heads and managing company finances.


Responsibilities


	Supervising staff performance across all levels.
	Releasing requested funds for company expenditure.
	Reviewing periodic reports and adjusting operations to better meet company goals.
	Conducting periodic employee appraisals.
	Overseeing procurement and staff recruitment.
	Overseeing staff training and development programs.
	Making professional decisions on behalf of the company at all times.
	Manage the company’s personnel, physical and financial resources to improve the company’s bottom line.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in business administration, accounting, or related field preferred.
	Minimum eight (8) years of experience in Leadership/Managerial roles.
	Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel).
	Ability to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions.
	Ability to negotiate, establish, and administer contracts.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently.
	Accurate and precise attention to detail.
	Goal-oriented, organized team player.
	The Ideal candidate should be a Female and within26-34 years of age. Candidates outside this bracket would not be considered..


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ebuka.o@fadacresources.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
